result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin J Maben was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs of DNA sample, all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges associated with this case by 7/7/16.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

*** July 15, 2014/Judge J.D.Watts/Defendant having filed to appear at the HOC, Court ordered a commitment out for service.  Huber privileges and/or electronic monitoring privileges REVOKED.Original commitment received and filed.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.   To commence on 7/8/2014 by noon.
 Huber privileges for work, NOT work search.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin J Maben

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court signed order denying defendant's reuest for release on electronic monitorin as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent.  Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for electronic monitoring.

Defendant having failed to appear at the House of Correction, Court ordered a commitment out for service.  Huber Privileges and/or electronic monitoring  privileges REVOKED.  Original commitment received and filed. sab

FAILURE TO REPORT COMMITMENT REFERRAL:
.
Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge  watts, Br 15, for review. os

FAILURE TO REPORT COMMITMENT REFERRAL:

Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge WATTS, Br 15, for review.OS

Defendant Devin J Maben in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.

  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 5 days served; Huber privileges for work - NOT work search. Sentence to commence on 07-08-14 by NOON

Court ordered the defendant to privide a DNA sample and pay the cost of same by 07-07-16.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges associated with this case by 07-07-16.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement.

Defense request for Dosage Probation is DNIED.

Defense request for expungement is DENIED

Appeal rights given
JUSTICE POINT report dated 07-03-14 received and filed.

Defendant Devin J Maben in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 7/7/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Devin J Maben in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/5/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devin J Maben in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Devin J Maben in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
